publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-156# Andrew Wilson: Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations—That the Parliament recognises the invaluable work done by the broad range of voluntary organisations and calls upon the Scottish Executive to ensure that no charge be levied against voluntary organisations when they apply to have their volunteers, staff and office holders checked by the Scottish Criminal Records Office with regard to child protection. Supported by: Colin Campbell*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Linda Fabiani*
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Michael Russell*, Irene McGugan*, Alex Neil*

S1M-156# Andrew Wilson: Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations—That the Parliament recognises the invaluable work done by the broad range of voluntary organisations and calls upon the Scottish Executive to ensure that no charge be levied against voluntary organisations when they apply to have their volunteers, staff and office holders checked by the Scottish Criminal Records Office with regard to child protection. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Michael Matheson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Alex Neil
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Dennis Canavan*, Fiona McLeod*

S1M-156# Andrew Wilson: Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations—That the Parliament recognises the invaluable work done by the broad range of voluntary organisations and calls upon the Scottish Executive to ensure that no charge be levied against voluntary organisations when they apply to have their volunteers, staff and office holders checked by the Scottish Criminal Records Office with regard to child protection. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Michael Matheson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Alex Neil, Dennis Canavan, Fiona McLeod
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Bill Aitken*, Ms Sandra White*, Alasdair Morgan*
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) David Mundell*, Phil Gallie*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Mr Andrew Welsh*, Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-156# Andrew Wilson: Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations-That the Parliament recognises the invaluable work done by the broad range of voluntary organisations and calls upon the Scottish Executive to ensure that no charge be levied against voluntary organisations when they apply to have their volunteers, staff and office holders checked by the Scottish Criminal Records Office with regard to child protection. Supported by: Colin Campbell, Michael Matheson, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Linda Fabiani, Michael Russell, Irene McGugan, Alex Neil, Dennis Canavan, Fiona McLeod, Bill Aitken, Ms Sandra White, Alasdair Morgan, David Mundell, Phil Gallie, Donald Gorrie, Mr Andrew Welsh, Dr Winnie Ewing
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Mr Murray Tosh*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*, Fergus Ewing*, Mr David Davidson*, Ian Jenkins*
S1M-156# Criminal Checks for Voluntary Organisations (lodged on 15 September 1999) Brian Adam*
